intro: Espostoa lanata subsp. huanucoensis, commonly known as the Huanuco wooly tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, mountainous environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
